author: Yan Tirta
title: Art DApps to fund & curate artwork
description: No. 1 problem of the art industry for the past 3 years is onboarding new collectors (tech savvy, gadget-driven millennials)

assessments.note: This proposal address the challenge of engaging Art community in Indonesia, which currently hasn't had much exposure to real day to day usecase in the country. Indonesias as well as their economy has major reliance on tourism and especially with their arts. After speaking with the proposer, I believe with the initial focus of being what he call a pool to art concepts, funding, and curator pool, this is a great jumpstart to the Indonesia community especially related to art and tourism. The main objective of this proposal is to bridge the gap between technology especially crypto with one of the most popular industry in Indonesia (art)

The proposal tries to solve an issue that is suited to be a flagship-project. I didn't find the information, why a dApp is specially suited for this problem but I like the commments that the proposer is in contact with other catalyst-teams and experience members in the scene. The wants to reuse outcomes of other projects. Like.
It's not clear what type of art dApp this will be developed as or who will specifically develop the platform. Missing the what and the how big time on this proposal.

This proposal focuses on creation of dapps within the teams' domain expertise of fine art on a platform that is itself a dapp. This method recognizes that the art world may be best served from a suite of dapps which will be used for specific facets of the art world. The overarching goal will be to bring in additional, new, current generation collectors to support the fine art world as a whole.

The proposal presented addresses the challenge, there was a great effort in the description and details of the problem and the solution presented was meticulously designed to create a solution with the potential to attract users with different interests related to NFTs for the dapp.
NFTs and NFT markets are the need of any blockchain ecosystem and the above proposal addresses both.
The challenge has been explained adequately deep.

The proposal include a couple people that are experienced in marketing in Art community as well as a couple implementer with experience in crypto as well as its regulation in Indonesia, which in and of itself could be a challenge that needs to be addressed. One of the key success criteria for this proposer is onboarding Sandiaga Uno (Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy) to promote the Art DApps platform through a webinar. This is quite a challenge but if implemented successful it could be huge for the crypto adoption community in Indonesia.
Veterans of the crypto-scene are a part of the team and according to a comment in the proposal, there is also exchange with other teams within catalyst.

The proposers have clear experience in the art space but it takes much more development skills than art experience to build a digital art platform. Never is it made clear (not even the development phases attachment) who will develop this platform

From the extensive documentation and clarity provided it is evident that the team has done plenty of research and has experience with project management within this space. Credibility is strong, and the team's profile is readily available with examples of previous work.

In general, the presented plan is well structured and detailed, there was great effort in creating a plan that contemplated different aspects and particularities of the project. There are many details about planning the marketing strategy, but few details about the development of dapp itself, who will be responsible for creating dapp and smart contracts? There are details about the team members and their qualifications, but there is not enough information about the team's expertise in relation to blockchain and smart contracts.

team is filled with experience people on both technical and practical side and having government connections in their country of origin is a value add which makes me believe that proposal will be implemented successfully.
Very clear roadmap and detailed plan. I believe that the proposer will be able to implement it successfully. Very detail of team member experience.

This is going to be a multi-year engagement if implemented fully, and the proposer have clear documentations outlining their plan for this initial engagement. The proposer attached a list of documentation to support their project such as project plan, budgeting/cost, wireframe to the GUI, launch plan, key performance indicators which layout success criteria at each steps.

As the proposer stated, the outcome of the project might me more a marketing effort, than the creation of the product itself. The steps to define success have a large gap regarding the actual implementation of the solution. I think this might be okay, but this is an aspect that troubles me a bit.
This proposal provides a lot of information but not entirely sure any of it is sufficient for the reasons listed above.

The in depth KPI document provides a rigorous set of objectives, detailed to the week. Although it might not happen perfectly it will strongly support methods to assess how effectively progress is being made while also showing that the team knows what it takes to get it done. for project completion, a key set of metrics which indicate reach and adoption have been selected.

There is a large amount of information indicating the feasibility of the proposal and its alignment with the challenge, but one point needs further clarification, the implementation of dapp itself and smart contracts, there is no mention of who will develop this part of the project.

the proposal do provide all the sufficient information asses the feasibility but however only problem is that there are too many proposals in NFT side which will create huge competition for the same market access and market share.
Information looks good, the required budget can be break down in more detail.

solution: Art DApps Platform, inspired by IdeaScale format with focus on creation and curation of arts collaborating with art-related Fund winners
experience:
Yan Tirta, Marcomm Manager of benda Art Management
Ignatia Nilu, Curator of ArtJog and ArtBali
Teguh Harmanda, COO of Tokocrypto
